title: Computer Fundamentals
content:
# Computer Fundamentals

## Definition
A computer is an electronic device that processes data according to a set of instructions (program).

## Generations of Computers

| Generation | Period | Technology | Example |
|------------|--------|------------|----------|
| First | 1940-1956 | Vacuum Tubes | ENIAC, UNIVAC |
| Second | 1956-1963 | Transistors | IBM 1620, CDC 1604 |
| Third | 1964-1971 | Integrated Circuits | IBM 360, PDP-8 |
| Fourth | 1971-Present | Microprocessors | Intel, AMD PCs |
| Fifth | Present-Future | AI & Quantum | Quantum computers |

## Types of Computers

### By Size
| Type | Use |
|------|-----|
| Supercomputer | Weather, Research (PARAM, Fugaku) |
| Mainframe | Banks, Airlines |
| Minicomputer | Departments |
| Microcomputer | Personal use (PC, Laptop) |

### By Purpose
- **General Purpose**: Multiple tasks
- **Special Purpose**: Single task (ATM, Traffic lights)

## Computer Components

### Hardware
Physical parts you can touch.

#### Input Devices
- Keyboard, Mouse
- Scanner, Microphone
- Webcam, Joystick
- Barcode reader

#### Output Devices
- Monitor, Printer
- Speaker, Projector
- Plotter

#### Processing
- **CPU**: Central Processing Unit (Brain)
  - ALU (Arithmetic Logic Unit)
  - CU (Control Unit)
  - Registers

#### Storage
- **Primary**: RAM, ROM, Cache
- **Secondary**: HDD, SSD, USB, CD/DVD

### Software
Programs and instructions.

#### System Software
- Operating System (Windows, Linux, macOS)
- Device Drivers
- Utilities

#### Application Software
- MS Office, Browsers
- Games, Media players

## Memory Units

| Unit | Size |
|------|------|
| Bit | 0 or 1 (smallest) |
| Byte | 8 bits |
| KB (Kilobyte) | 1024 Bytes |
| MB (Megabyte) | 1024 KB |
| GB (Gigabyte) | 1024 MB |
| TB (Terabyte) | 1024 GB |
| PB (Petabyte) | 1024 TB |

## Important Abbreviations

| Abbreviation | Full Form |
|--------------|------------|
| CPU | Central Processing Unit |
| RAM | Random Access Memory |
| ROM | Read Only Memory |
| BIOS | Basic Input Output System |
| USB | Universal Serial Bus |
| URL | Uniform Resource Locator |
| HTML | HyperText Markup Language |
| HTTP | HyperText Transfer Protocol |

title: Microsoft Office Suite
content:
# Microsoft Office Suite

## MS Word

### Purpose
Word processing - Creating documents, letters, reports.

### File Extension: .docx (older: .doc)

### Important Shortcuts
| Shortcut | Function |
|----------|----------|
| Ctrl + N | New document |
| Ctrl + O | Open file |
| Ctrl + S | Save |
| Ctrl + P | Print |
| Ctrl + Z | Undo |
| Ctrl + Y | Redo |
| Ctrl + C | Copy |
| Ctrl + X | Cut |
| Ctrl + V | Paste |
| Ctrl + A | Select all |
| Ctrl + B | Bold |
| Ctrl + I | Italic |
| Ctrl + U | Underline |
| Ctrl + F | Find |
| Ctrl + H | Find & Replace |

### Features
- Mail Merge
- Track Changes
- Headers/Footers
- Table of Contents
- Spell Check

## MS Excel

### Purpose
Spreadsheet - Calculations, data analysis, charts.

### File Extension: .xlsx (older: .xls)

### Structure
- **Workbook**: Excel file
- **Worksheet**: Individual sheet
- **Cell**: Intersection of row and column (e.g., A1)
- **Rows**: 1,048,576 (max)
- **Columns**: 16,384 (A to XFD)

### Important Functions
| Function | Purpose | Example |
|----------|---------|----------|
| SUM | Add values | =SUM(A1:A10) |
| AVERAGE | Mean value | =AVERAGE(A1:A10) |
| MAX | Largest value | =MAX(A1:A10) |
| MIN | Smallest value | =MIN(A1:A10) |
| COUNT | Count numbers | =COUNT(A1:A10) |
| IF | Conditional | =IF(A1>10,"Yes","No") |
| VLOOKUP | Vertical lookup | =VLOOKUP(value,range,col,FALSE) |
| CONCATENATE | Join text | =CONCATENATE(A1," ",B1) |

### Cell References
- **Relative**: A1 (changes when copied)
- **Absolute**: $A$1 (doesn't change)
- **Mixed**: $A1 or A$1

## MS PowerPoint

### Purpose
Presentations - Slides, animations, multimedia.

### File Extension: .pptx (older: .ppt)

### Features
- Slide layouts
- Animations & Transitions
- Master slides
- Presenter view
- Export to PDF/Video

### Views
- Normal View
- Slide Sorter
- Reading View
- Slide Show

## Common Shortcuts (All Office)

| Shortcut | Function |
|----------|----------|
| Ctrl + N | New |
| Ctrl + W | Close |
| F1 | Help |
| F5 | Slide show (PPT) |
| F7 | Spell check |
| F12 | Save As |
| Ctrl + Home | Go to beginning |
| Ctrl + End | Go to end |

title: Internet and Networking
content:
# Internet and Networking

## What is Internet?
Global network of interconnected computers that communicate using standardized protocols.

### History
- **1969**: ARPANET (First network)
- **1983**: TCP/IP adopted
- **1989**: WWW invented by Tim Berners-Lee
- **1991**: India connected to Internet

## Key Terms

| Term | Definition |
|------|------------|
| WWW | World Wide Web - Collection of web pages |
| URL | Uniform Resource Locator - Web address |
| HTTP | Protocol for web communication |
| HTTPS | Secure HTTP (encrypted) |
| HTML | Language for creating web pages |
| Browser | Software to access web (Chrome, Firefox) |
| ISP | Internet Service Provider |
| IP Address | Unique identifier for devices |
| Domain | Website name (google.com) |
| DNS | Converts domain to IP address |

## Types of Networks

| Type | Full Form | Range |
|------|-----------|-------|
| LAN | Local Area Network | Building/Campus |
| MAN | Metropolitan Area Network | City |
| WAN | Wide Area Network | Country/World |
| PAN | Personal Area Network | Few meters |
| WLAN | Wireless LAN | Wi-Fi coverage |

## Network Devices

| Device | Function |
|--------|----------|
| Modem | Converts digital to analog signals |
| Router | Directs data between networks |
| Switch | Connects devices in LAN |
| Hub | Basic network connection (obsolete) |
| Gateway | Connects different networks |
| Firewall | Security - blocks unauthorized access |

## Internet Services

### Email (Electronic Mail)
- Send/receive messages
- Protocols: SMTP (send), POP3/IMAP (receive)
- Examples: Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo Mail

### Search Engines
- Find information on web
- Examples: Google, Bing, Yahoo, DuckDuckGo

### Social Media
- Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn

### E-Commerce
- Amazon, Flipkart, eBay

## Internet Protocols

| Protocol | Purpose |
|----------|----------|
| TCP/IP | Base protocol for internet |
| HTTP/HTTPS | Web pages |
| FTP | File transfer |
| SMTP | Sending email |
| POP3/IMAP | Receiving email |
| SSH | Secure remote access |
| VPN | Virtual Private Network |

## Security Threats

| Threat | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Virus | Self-replicating malicious program |
| Worm | Spreads through network |
| Trojan | Disguised as legitimate software |
| Spyware | Monitors user activity |
| Ransomware | Encrypts files, demands payment |
| Phishing | Fake websites to steal data |

## Safety Measures
- Use strong passwords
- Keep software updated
- Use antivirus software
- Don't click suspicious links
- Use HTTPS websites
- Enable two-factor authentication
